text.p: The IAAF international athletics meeting in Sestriere next month could be cancelled if major sponsors do not come forward, organisers said on Monday.
"We are looking for sponsors to cover the costs of this meeting," Livio Berruti, press officer for the company which manages the resort, said.

Berruti said sponsors were needed to finance a part of the one billion lire ($590,000) costs of the July 19 meeting, in the run up to August's World Championships in Athens, but he did not specify the exact amount of the shortfall.
He said a decision on the meeting's future would be made in the next few days.
Organisers have traditionally offered a Ferrari car for anyone breaking a world record at the meeting.
Italian newspapers reported on Monday that the resort was in a bad financial shape after hosting the Alpine skiing World Championships earlier this year.
Berruti denied the reports and said rising costs and lack of public support for development projects were the two main factors which put the athletics meeting at risk.
"We have not had great help from outside. The costs are more each year but the finances don't always increase," he said.
